website_summaries.verdict: CORSAIR’s line of gaming mouse pads are built with durability, comfort, and an all-around premium gaming experience in mind that is well worth the initial investment.
cons: This is a fairly expensive gaming mouse pad, but it’s worth it for hardcore PC players

customer_reviews.title: Honestly thought this was a bad idea at first.
customer_reviews.text: Don't get me wrong, I absolutely LOVE Corsair and their line of products, I use their RAM kits, cases, keyboards, etc. So when my friend one day decided to get the RGB headset stand. I decided to go one up on him and get this mousepad. Boy am I glad I bought it. It actually is more comfortable to use and when paired with my M65 works amazingly. Sure, not everyone is into making their desks looking like unicorn barf, but I think the mousepad is a nice touch to the RGB keyboard and mouse that I already have. On a side note. Maybe your cat will like it. Mine likes to sleep on it for some reason.
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: This thing is fantastic
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. It's like the finishing touch to my RGB system. The software makes it so you have an incredible amount of control over the lighting effects, and it feels so quality. I boxing experience was phenomenal. I wasn't sure if I would like the switch from a felt mousepad to a hard top mousepad, but it feels so smooth and effortless to move the mouse that once you get used to it, you'll never want to use felt a mousepad again.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Awesome but with a no light-up bug
customer_reviews.text: I love Corsair products but their software is horrible until they finally iron out the bugs. Pad doesn't always light up until restart.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan H

customer_reviews.title: Smells kinda weird, color is a little off, but it works great!
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I opened the Amazon package, an almost fishy rubber smell hit me. Very strong, but it seems like the cats like it! I'm sure it will go away as it breaks in. One other complaint is the pictures on Amazon make this look grey, but it's much more of a reddish-brown color. Not a deal breaker at all, but I like the idea of a grey pad better. Performance wise, this pad is awesome. Very smooth and feels comfy under your hands and forearms. It's pretty happy to stay where you place it, and feels pretty heavy when you pick it up, in a good way.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Slick pad to rest keyboard and mouse
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for use with a new mechanical keyboard for my home office. I like that this pad isn't too tall that it takes up almost the whole desk but is long enough for the keyboard, mouse, and even a cellphone or other things next to it. The pad is thinner than one I was using previously but I don't think that's a big deal unless you want a more cushiony feel. One thing I did notice right away is that mouse movements are much faster since the fabric seems a lot slicker than the traditional mousepad. I imagine this would be good for gaming (which I don't do) but also works well for normal tasks.
customer_reviews.author: TChewy

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse pad for looks and production!
customer_reviews.text: I am not much of a mouse/keyboard game player as I do a lot of controller gamer, but I do a lot of production style work as well. This is an awesome mouse pad. Huge surface area, the RGB colors are bright, and when you mix it with a Corsair RGB mouse and Keyboard, the Corsair Utility software makes all three work well together. Overall, a mouse pad is a mouse pad as far as how it functions. I really see no point in buying this unless you like the RGB funtions, which I was wanting to add to my Corsair mouse and Keyboard. Great combination with all three for a RGB display.
customer_reviews.author: MetalMan462

customer_reviews.title: Less than 14 days old, already uselessly damaged
customer_reviews.text: didn't even make two weeks and it's peeling apart. it's complete junk. Do not spend your money on corsair products. I literally got a better mousepad for the same price from an off-brand and it was waaaaay better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Byron B

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Smell
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice big mouse pad, but it absolutely stinks. I put it outside for two days and that still didn't take away the intense odor. Every mouse pad and wrist rest I've ever owned has had some odor that lessens over time, but this one is particularly awful.
customer_reviews.author: lcfeminist

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than expected. Works just fine.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. My mouse tracks a bit faster on this than my other very thin gaming mouse pad, so had to adjust the sensitivity a bit to get back to what I was used to. I got the "medium" size, which is still quite big. More than enough room. I'm not doing any hardcore gaming, just wanted a good reliable pad for my main programming workstation computer. I have rolled it up several times to put in my camera/laptop backpack when travelling, and it has held up just fine. No issues with edges remaining curled up after unrolling.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Sherrard

customer_reviews.title: Great for office use
customer_reviews.text: I use this at work because my hand was cramping from using a mouse on a regular mousepad. I work in front of a computer all day so I go back and forth but was getting annoyed that my mouse kept falling off the mousepad and my keyboard would constantly bump into it. I also would constantly rearrange my setup because I use a notebook in front of the computer as well. Now it's much cleaner and smoother. I love how my mouse feels on the cloth, it feels like butter. I can have my keyboard on top of it too. It does pick up dust and lint because it's black but I keep a lint roller for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: leed

customer_reviews.title: Hopefully its shortcomings can be fixed in a software update
customer_reviews.text: As a mousepad it's perfectly sufficient. You have a wide area to glide your mouse over the smooth surface. Of course, that's not why you would buy this product. For it's flash and jazz, the RGB LEDs work well, but where the experience fails is that it does not maintain your animations when you lock or sleep the computer. My custom red/orange flickering flame look amazing when I'm actually at my computer, but it always reverts back to the spinny bright rainbow animation. Just note - the only other product on the market that competes with this does not have the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: Just Matt

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent mousepad. No performance complaints.
customer_reviews.text: I received this product with some really bad bend lines in it, probably from being packaged so long. It also had a small nick on the surface, but I'm not one who is a perfectionist. It feels great tracking the mouse and my hand across the pad, and over time the pad started to even out and become smooth again. Besides the edges, bends, and the nick, very good product!
customer_reviews.author: Hortonhearsajet

customer_reviews.title: RBG is cool, USB is nice for charging
customer_reviews.text: Many companies sell this, Corsair as expected is expensive for what you get. Yes not many people like iCue software but it gets the job done. I have to however, dock a star because the bump at the top for the USB could have been MUCH smaller since it is not the bump takes away from the aesthetics. At this price point I would have like to see it much smaller because when you are using it with a wires mouse or charging a wireless mouse the cable can has a habit of dragging over the bump and that can get annoying in long term teaming gaming sessions.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Smells disgusting like mold.
customer_reviews.text: Like many others, I bought this thing its a good deal, because it is. But it smells extremely bad. I don't consider myself to be someone easily affected by smells either. This made me feel sick. It smells like an extremely strong mold. I even tried to combat it with Febreeze. The smell overpowers even Febreeze. I will just buy a more expensive mouse pad rather than to deal with this extremely smelly pad.
customer_reviews.author: Rocco

customer_reviews.title: It only charges on one small spot on pad and it takes time to position just right!
customer_reviews.text: First, I thought this would charge the mouse all the time like Logitech's mouse pad does, but no, it's just in the top right corner and you have to position it just right. If it flashes fast that means very poor connection (always happens) you have to reposition to get slow flash meaning good charging. So, if you forget to move your mouse to the corner at night, it will be dead tomorrow (only 18 hour lifespan on mouse according to my reads). Logitech's charges no matter where the mouse is! Granted this is 60% cheaper than Logitechs and is Qi charging where Logitech's charging is proprietary, but that wasn't good enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: Devan

customer_reviews.title: Great Overall
customer_reviews.text: I was looking specifically for an RGB mouse pad. I chose this one because I bought a Corsair keyboard and liked the quality. This one didn’t disappoint. The RGB is noticeable yet subtle enough that it’s not lighting up the entire room. The fact that it works with iCue allows me to sync my color theme across all my Corsair devices. The additional USB port accommodates my mouse so it frees up a port on the pc. The hard surface takes some getting used to if you haven’t spent air of time on them. Overall I am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kemosabe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mousepad
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mouse pad. The material is top quality and it's very comfortable to work on, it also feels pretty solid and like it will last for a while. I really like the size as I use two monitors side by side so I can move my keyboard and mouse around on the pad freely and have enough space to shift my primary work position to either screen if i need to. Also plenty of space to shift everything over when my cat decides that my work desk is a nice place to put herself.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Quite possibly the best mouse surface Corsair has made!
customer_reviews.text: Im super impressed with the M350 mouse pad. Ive been using a jumbo sized m300 for a few years now and its been fantastic, but wow, I gotta say this M350 goes above and beyond my expectations! The surface is smoother, silkier, than the 300, yet retains a good amount of control grip, so your mouse isn't sliding all over the place and over shooting targets. Its also slightly thicker than the 300 which is nice for fatigue reduction. To me, this is the Goldilocks mouse pad. Its juuuust right!
customer_reviews.author: John D.

customer_reviews.title: Finicky
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Qi-rechargeable mouse at the same time. The idea was to leave the mouse on the "hot spot" when not in use, so that it would just always be charged up. Seemed like a good idea, but in practice doesn't work as well as I'd hoped. Mostly, either the mouse or this charge pad is very picky about placement. I generally have to pick up the mouse and set it back down on the "hot spot" several times before charging will start. Not sure whether the problem is with the mouse or this pad.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Reed

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, design hides dust and stains very well.
customer_reviews.text: The design of this mouse pad helps hide dust and stains much better than a plain black mouse pad. This is a mouse pad you could spill coffee on and after wiping it down you would never know. Looks awesome with my corsair peripherals.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: I got this item on sale and did not pay too much attention to the size (impulse buy on slick deals...) I like it - but it does occupy a fair amount of desk real estate (10.5" x 12.5"). I could almost cut it in half for two mini mouse pads... I tend to use it in 'Portrait mode' most of the time. Will use landscape mode for big projects or something. I'm sure this would be perfect for some people - gamers and designers and such. The logo matches my Corsair watercooler - so that is nice ;^) Came in a nice box - would make a nice gift!
customer_reviews.author: LanceSword

customer_reviews.title: love the design, quality
customer_reviews.text: I had MM200 extended for about a year and the area where I use my mouse had been too worn out for gaming (lowering precisions). I flipped the sides so that the unused left part is now used for my mouse. Well, I recently accidently spilled drinks so thought I might as well get a new gaming pad. MM300 anti-fray just got here and the surface feels a little different. I like the design better than the previous one and it looks cool. I think I feel a bit more friction when using my mouse on this compared to M200. I like the new pad so far and will have to see how much longer this will last.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great. Always worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.text: This has always been my favorite mousepad. I’ve probably purchased 3 of these since my first one and that’s only because I refuse to wash my mousepads. They’re affordable enough that it’s just worth buying a new one. The glide is perfect and the design is wonderful too. It’s not loud or crazy looking but it’s not just flat black. If you didn’t know that you need to wash your mousepads then it’s probably time for you to buy this thing anyway. Lol. Cheers.
customer_reviews.author: Rigel Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Another great Corsair product!
customer_reviews.text: I love Corsair products. My computer uses their water cooler, their ram, and I have the USB headphone stand/sound card, and this mouse pad. I'm able to coordinate the RGB lighting between them effortlessly. This mousepad is large, the lighting works perfectly and adds fun to my deskktop. I like that the logo glows, too. If you want a hard RGB mouse pad, this is a great option. If you already own Corsair RGB items, buying it is a no brainer. I would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Z.

customer_reviews.title: Can't Change Onboard Default
customer_reviews.text: I regret this purchase. For a product as novelty and silly as a colored-light mouse pad, it certainly disappoints. You can't change the onboard profile default color setting, so by default the mouse mat will resort to the ugly rainbow spiral. This default color mode plays when the computer is turned on, restarted, or locked (which means a screensaver OR sitting in the login screen). Awful design flaw and I'm currently looking for ways to get rid of it and purchase a different product, possibly from a different company.
customer_reviews.author: robolab

customer_reviews.title: Smells like burning plastic.
customer_reviews.text: It smells so bad that it gave me a headache just standing in the same room. It smells like burning plastic and I can't get rid of the smell even after first spraying it with vinegar and water then washing it by hand. Also, even though the box was new and factory sealed, the pad's stitched edges were already showing wear. It must be from rubbing in the box. If the smell dissipates it might be decent. We will see.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: nice gaming pad
customer_reviews.text: More than sufficient for my needs. I'm not a avid/pro/intense gamer. Just occasional gaming and this pad is reasonable. I am using the Logitech G602 wireless mouse. Initially, my pointer and mouse response was iffy but it turned out to be the Logitech mouse receiver dongle. It was probably about 2 feet away on a USB hub but after I moved to a usb slot on my keyboard so its right next to mouse, it works great!
customer_reviews.author: boubacar

customer_reviews.title: First Experience
customer_reviews.text: Mouse pads have always turned me off, but I got this one for free from Corsair and have been using it ever since. I'm very happy with it because other mouse pads I've seen are like rubber or whatever and I really don't like the materials they use because if it gets wet or something, it's easier to wear and harder to clean. Thankfully, this isn't. There's also a pass through USB port. The mouse pad is also wide enough, just the perfect size for my desk. Most mouse pads I've seen are too wide or too small. This is also the first mouse pad I'm sticking with as well. I'd highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Bui

customer_reviews.title: Long and big and excellent.
customer_reviews.text: This mouse and keyboard Corsair MM300 - Anti-Fray Cloth Gaming Mouse Pad is big. Really big. It's like maybe 8-10 regular mouse-pads got together one weekend and Mighty Morphin'd into its final form and just started kicking some ass. Wish it came in more colors or styles or something-brazen pink or ocean green. But this thing seems high quality and the stitching seems like it will help keep it intact for much longer than a typical heavy use mouse pad.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton White

customer_reviews.title: Game changer!
customer_reviews.text: After using a hard mousepad from Corsair for years, I switched to this one to give me more room for more precision in FPS games. I had my doubts about going back to cloth but boy do I love this thing now. It is very smooth and tracks great with a G900. It looks sweet on my desk and seems quite durable. I am now a cloth man again. I still like the glide from the hard mousepad better, but this one feels superb in its own way. And the price was incredible. Give it a shot and you probably won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Sterks

customer_reviews.title: Nice but with a design flaw.
customer_reviews.text: It works and has a nice RGB.. however the connector area that is raised has sharp corners that catch the mouse cable which gets annoying to the point I rotate the pad a bit just so it stops catching. If the raised area had a more gradual slope it would work a lot better.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lanning

customer_reviews.title: Perfect long mat for large desks
customer_reviews.text: This is a basic long mat. So far it has done well with my general use of it everyday. I have not spilled anything on it so far so i do not know how well it can take liquids or grease. Pros: Extra long mat for large desks Thick padding Soft/ smooth feel Fairly grippy bottom Cons: Limited patterns to choose from. Might need some weight placed on edges to flatten properly.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: A bit expensive for what it is
customer_reviews.text: Not sure this *really* supports the pricetag, but overall this is a really cool product. The pad itself is great; very responsive and as good if not better than anything I have bought from the Razer set of pad products. The RGB effects are also great, you can use the Corsair software to coordinate the colors, patterns, etc. It isn't most intuitive software, but if you have more than 1 Corsair product you can set up profiles and manage all of your devices in one place which is a nice plus. 4-starred simply because of the price. If you can get this on sale, absolutely buy it! Even without the sale, I am extremely happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: smell, wow.
customer_reviews.text: Wow this things smells so strong of chemicals and rubber that I couldn't breathe in the same room let alone game with it. Returing immediately. My hands smell all gross even after touching it. Unacceptable and poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: N. Neice

customer_reviews.title: Icemat? lol.. goodbye. Say Hello to Corsair's Best mousepad!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using my green icemat (tempered frosted glass in green) since 2008. Fast forward 2019. Time for something new to match some of the other corsair gear on my desk. Enter this mousepad. GREAT price. Full rubber backing for anti slip. And the surface coupled with my harpoon rgb is so satisfying I can't see myself switching again except for a larger or newer model or one with a built in mouse bungee/headset stand. 10/10 would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: BP&JP

customer_reviews.title: If you have the space, buy this mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mouse pad. I had just purchased a Large mouse pad a mere month before this popped up on sale. Timing was great, as I had just set up my second gaming PC for my wife to use. This mouse pad is big enough to throw a keyboard and mouse on if you want. I just use it as a XXL mouse pad and just plop my controllers on it without worrying about denting my desk or damaging the controller.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: worst smell
customer_reviews.text: Trust me the smell is sooooo bad. I never found any mouse pad that could smell like this. Too chemical smell. not to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this mouse pad!!
customer_reviews.text: While these are made for gamers, which I am not one, this pad is fantastic for the "average joe" who like's a little flash on the desk. My mouse is more accurate on this pad and in turn has been better to use. I put it next to my RGB mechanical keyboard also from Corsair and have received many compliments from those that see it. As an added bonus the lighting effects are calming.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Nice surface, charging kinda sucks
customer_reviews.text: In a massive departure from every other corsair product in existence, this mouse pad has no RGB lighting even though it has what looks like it should be RGB lighting along the top row. The surface is really nice to use and my mouse (dark core SE) glides across it like nobody's business. It feels well built, but the keystone feature that I paid a premium for, Qi charging, is finicky and hard to get anything positioned properly to use. to sum, mouse pad feels nice but the charging feature is butts. not worth the premium.
customer_reviews.author: James & Mara

customer_reviews.title: Great quality feel, but lining up my Samsung for wireless charging is a bit of work.
customer_reviews.text: Got this coz I saw it packaged with either a keyboard or mouse, but couldn't get that package shipped to Korea, but I am persistent and found one sold separately. I like how nicely the mouse glides over it as well as the wireless charging and built in USB port which is subtly placed so it is handy but not immediately visible. Would have given it 5 stars if only there was a convenient way to quickly place my phone for charging.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: VERY durable and smooth
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this mat for a long time now and I can safely say you will not beat this mat for gaming purposes. I'm using an RGB Corsair keyboard with a razer deathadder chroma. This peripherals feel amazing when on the mat and I can easily slide the mouse around the mat to get my precise options when playing any games. This mat feels smooth still to this date and is machine washable. How could you go wrong for a mat this durable?
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great, inexpensive, Quality mouse pad!  Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made, soft, smooth mouse surface. Works great with both Photoshop / Editing AND Games. Very easy now to get much more precise action out of my Logitech G502 mouse. It sits very flat with no curling as many cheaper pads like to do. No slippage on my wood table. The light color is also good for darker settings when I game at night. Daylight is for my editing and artwork. I'm very impressed with the quality for the price. Good job, guys. You hit a home run for something that should be so easy, yet is so often screwed up! ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Blarney77

customer_reviews.title: the lighting looks good
customer_reviews.text: i like it. the lighting looks good and the pad is bigger then a normal pad and it also have a USB build in it which is nice to connect the mouse right on to it. if you are a person who like lights on your keyboard/mouse then you will most likely like this mouse pad. You can even customize the light with the Corsair program called iCUE which they wont tell you about in any manual so you just have to go find it. Overall, it goes very nice with Corsair keyboard and mouse due to the lightnings.
customer_reviews.author: Yee

customer_reviews.title: Huge and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this mouse pad everyday since I ordered it and it's great. It's smooth, comfortable, and tracks my mouse as well as I could ask. I like the simplicity of it and the size. None of the ends have frayed and I just clean it every few weeks with a wet washcloth and it still looks as new as the day I got it. Really great wide mouse mat Corsair!
customer_reviews.author: Choose901

customer_reviews.title: Does Cadillac make gaming mats? NOPE, but Corsair does!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. Will not be disappointed unless you wanted a small pad. Its huge, soft, cushy, and has a beautifully done double stitch around the mat.. this is the Cadillac of gaming mats.
customer_reviews.author: Murdaklez

customer_reviews.title: Very durable, no damage after 3 years.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this Corsair mat for 3 years now and it's still holding strong. I've eaten on it, I've spilled drinks on it, and I've thrown in it the dryer multiple times. Despite all this, there has been absolutely no fraying on the stitches and the stains are not too noticeable thanks to the design. I am very happy with this mat. It's comfortable, keeps your keyboard in place, and continues to endure after all my abuse, you really can't ask for more.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Sang

customer_reviews.title: Too Much Money
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the money. Did not notice any difference between it and a Roccat Taito mid size mouse mat. I didn't pay near as much for the Roccat then what I paid for this. Lesson learned, Amazon hides real reviews so if you read this count your blessings. The USB port on it has worked without fail and the RGB looks good. Hence the two stars, If you have gobs of money then you would pay more anyway. Someone on a budget looking for a decent pad can buy cheaper options at a better price. The I Cue software has glitches which is a shame because the concept is awesome
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great mouspad. Very smooth glide with my Logitech G502.
customer_reviews.text: I really love the larger mouse pads for my desk. This was to replace my previous mouse pad that I bought from an off brand seller. I didn't think there would be such a large difference between this mouse pad and the one that I had before, but it is actually a noticeable difference in how smooth my mouse movements feel on this mouse pad. My G502 gaming mouse glides effortlessly over this mouse pad. The thick construction feels durable and is comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hathaway

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I'm coming from the Razer Firefly RGB Mousepad, and I must say, this Corsair one is a huge upgrade. The Razer one I had wore out in less than 6 months to the point where my mouse would get stuck in certain places because I wore out the mouse pad pretty heavily and the entire mous pad became smooth, and the build quality of Razer's products just aren't up to par when it comes to Corsairs products. The LED's on this mouse pad are very bright, and not an under glow type of mouse pad either, like the Firefly was. Would highly suggest this mouse pad, especially because it has a USB port built into it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Good solid surface for the mouse
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rug only because I am a fan of Corsair. And I was not mistaken, the Mat has rgb illumination on three sides and one usb connector, as well as a textured surface on which a gaming mouse from the same company can walk very smoothly. However, after two years of use, the first signs of wear on the surface of the Mat are already visible. Very high quality and stylish product, happy and recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Sober01ShT

customer_reviews.title: Constant issues.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this and it worked fine for a few weeks, then stop lighting up completely. Tried the fixes where you uninstall from device manager and reinstall, but now it's just green and doesn't work with iCue. Tried updating and reinstalling, it works fine for a little bit, then stops again. Not really what I expected for a $60 mouse mat.
customer_reviews.author: B.

customer_reviews.title: The worst mat. Rough surface, nicks my Naga Trinity mouse smoothers
customer_reviews.text: I saw this was Corsair, and had bought computer parts in the past, they were good. But this piece of crap is terrible. This pad is complete trash. it will snare my mouse. the fringe border came in the box already lifted insome parts!!!!!!!!!!! I though it would of been high quality. but, now i wont even consider this brand for anything gamer related. Disappointment at high level.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Aguiar

customer_reviews.title: stealthy
customer_reviews.text: I like corsair, and I don't mind their branding. but too bad the logo was really big and it is cheaply ironed on. It started peeling on the edges when I unboxed it. The logo surface is kinda tacky too, doesn't feel nice. I ended up using brake cleaner and wipe off the whole logo, and now it's nice and stealthy. wish it was thicker tho.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon    Customer

customer_reviews.title: Appears worn / dirty after just a month - look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: Started off in love with this thing, it made mousing quieter and easier and kept my keyboard from moving around. Plus, it gave my desk a "unified" appearance. A month or so in, however, I noticed it was taking on a white cast in the areas where my hands and wrists usually are. Not sure what it is, but its really gross (probably dead skin?) and seems to be impossible to clean. So, unless you wear gloves or don't mind your mousepad looking dirty and worn after just a month of use, you probably should look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: slushiercashew

customer_reviews.title: Great desktop on the go.
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I do CADD as part of my job. Computer drawing. Anyone doing this knows your mouse can tend to drift on you and wind up off the mousepad. This allows me to freely draw without recentering. Also I travel some for work and wind up at Starbucks a lot. The pad creates a desk surface that is consistent from table to table while protecting your laptop and phone and, for me, an external keyboard. It’s really great. I love it. Also get lots of inquiries about it. People respond well to it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Easley

customer_reviews.title: CORSAIR MM800 Polaris RGB Mouse Pad
customer_reviews.text: Im a corsair fan, so maybe a little bit biased. This thing is awesome. Its bigger than i though, about 12x12 inches, and 1/4 inch high, except for the plug housing which is 1 inch high, 2x2. Very sturdy, doesnt move at all. Sleek and colorful. Software works great, works with Icue as well. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Scuba_Steve

customer_reviews.title: Extra large mouse/keyboard pad that is perfect for the gamer in the house
customer_reviews.text: This is now my second one of these mouse pads, as my son loved mine enough that he wanted his own. He often ended up with his pad and mouse pushed away so far that he had to stretch to reach. This large pad keeps everything in line and offers room to spare. We may adjust his layout to give more mouse room as he has the majority of the pad off to his left and under the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: CoreyZ

customer_reviews.title: It's bigger than you think.
customer_reviews.text: Likes. This mouse pad is huge. It would be hard to have your mouse slide off this mouse pad. I have had this mouse pad for about 2 months so far. I use it for both work and personal use with no issues. Dislikes. It hasn’t made me skinnier. I’m still going bald. And it will not tell me the winning lotto numbers. Seriously, I have no dislikes yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I like the large pad. No worries about keeping the mouse on a smaller pad. I like how it covers a lot of my desk. I like the hemmed edges. They add a tiny big of discomfort as the hemmed edges aren't as soft as the normal cut edges, but this will last longer has I've had lots of pad in experience have the fabric on top start to separate from the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Love this mouse pad!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a Corsair guy so I’m a bit bias maybe 😇 My recent rig is built with a monster Corsair case as my others are. From pad to mouse, keyboard and water cooling I used all Corsair RGB. The pad is more for us overkill builders yet, the good size surface is nice as one need not concern themselves with slipping the mouse of the pad while gaming and such. The rear USB port is perfect for my fingerprint dongle as it is nice and discreet as well as convenient. 😉
customer_reviews.author: Jwoods

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality, great performance...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice mouse pad. I wanted something large enough to hold both my keyboard and mouse on my slide out keyboard tray attached to my desk. This mouse pad was just the right size for my purposes. The mouse pad is well made and my mouse tracks smoothly across the surface. As well, it works well with the sensor on my mouse, providing very precise control during fast paced gaming activities.
customer_reviews.author: STEVEN K.

customer_reviews.title: Wireless Charging pad is just awful.
customer_reviews.text: Let me preface this with - I've owned the K90, K70, 2x Strafe's, the Void, scimitar, MM800 and now the MM1000 and Darkcore SE. The entire point of the MM1000 and Darkcore is to take advantage of the wireless charging, and it's a nightmare to get it to work. It takes more time to find the sweet spot where the mouse will charge correctly than it would to just plug it in and let it charge while you're AFK/doing something else. I genuinely don't see a point for this setup, at all, unless the entire pad could charge the mouse. 2 stars is being generous.
customer_reviews.author: P.Mc

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size for Mouse and Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Mouse works amazing on this mouse pad. Also the size is just perfect to fit my whole G710+ keyboard and still have ample room for the mouse as well as space for wither my phone or water bottle. The design isn't distracting and while something more instersting seems nice, most of it is covered by a keyboard anyway. Feels very heavy duty, without being too thick. It did have a strong rubber smell for about 1-2 days, but after that I haven't noticed it. The weave is a great blend of speed and control for my G600 mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Britney Mecham

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! I wish Corsair made better keyboard and mouse so you can have all the same brand to use with it. I bought the K70 Rapidfire, and it had problems and haven't found a Corsair mouse that is good for gaming. Right now I am using the Logitec G513 Carbon keyboard and the Logitec G502 mouse, and they work well for gaming. Back to the mouse pad, it is very durable and has many RGB lighting effects. The only thing that I have a problem with but it is not a deal breaker is it does want to turn as I am playing on it over time.
customer_reviews.author: HarryKaincles

customer_reviews.title: Updated my whole look!
customer_reviews.text: I use an old beat up door as a desk, and putting this down really cleaned up the whole space and made it look so much more professional. The quality seems great, the printing is good and the surface is nice. I've used my mouse on it and it glides well, it's a bit fast for me, but I'm more of a textured mousepad kind of person. And I'm not switching out anytime soon. So for my use this is definitely more of a cosmetic than anything.
customer_reviews.author: Ugzz

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful addition for LED addicted gamers.
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect sized mouse pad, the LED's are a huge plus, and the extra powered USB port is useful. I love how it syncs with my corsair K95 keyboard too for lighting. The mouse reading surface is nice and finely gritty. It helps my mouse read detailed movement well. I recommend this to anybody with the cast to spend on it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard C. Mangan

customer_reviews.title: Great Mat!
customer_reviews.text: I love the quality! The design is super cool, and the edge border of the mat is nice! Since it ships rolled up it has a bit of a tendency to stick up on the edges for a while, hit mine is almost worked in completely now. All and all, I love the mat and I will be using mine in my setup indefinitely!
customer_reviews.author: TechnologyEnthusiast21

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly effective addition
customer_reviews.text: I picked one of these up on a friend's recommendation. I didn't think having such a large swath of my desk being a mouse pad would matter. I was wrong. Indeed, this lets me make very large swooping gestures and have them be very precise. Sometimes when I'm gaming my enthusiasm level gets the best of me and this helps correct for that. This is one of those few products that has changed my mind about something. Now I want one of these for my desk at work.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Evans

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Exciting Colors.......
customer_reviews.text: Comes with a "built in Magic Trick" That is very impressive. You are sitting at your computer - push your key board back a bit. start tapping your finger TIPS on the table top in front of your keyboard as though you were playing the drums using your finger TIPS.... Get the rythim going and slam your finger tips hard into the counter top or table. The RGB mouse & the mouse pad turn off..... they blink and then come back on .........!! Ta Da !!
customer_reviews.author: Majik Imaje

customer_reviews.title: This was the one thing that got me to purchase one month of Amazon Prime
customer_reviews.text: That's some seriously thick surround stitching. Nearly twice as thick as the Anker gaming mouse pad it replaced. I was a little concerned that with the variations of color I may encounter tracking issues. My concern was unwarranted as my Logitech G402 tracks flawlessly across the surface. Accompanies a glass desktop nicely. Doesn't shift around on me. Makes my CM Storm Stealth Tenkeyless Keyboard with PBT doubleshot keycaps feel almost as solid as the KUL ES-87. Almost. Made in Taiwan. I wonder if we can visit the factory. Road trip!
customer_reviews.author: David N. Goliath

customer_reviews.title: Solid product from Corsair.
customer_reviews.text: Was concerned about the comfort of the stitched edge but thread is soft an not at all abrasive on my wrist. Bottom surface is grippy on my table and the top surface has just enough grip to keep my keyboard from sliding around. Keyboard has rubber feet up front and just plastic risers on the back. My logitech G503 mouse seems to work well on the surface even with the printed image. I can't speak for other mice as some may have an issue with this and prefer a solid color surface. Happy so far with the purchase as I've been using it every day for several weeks with no issues and no signs of wear.
customer_reviews.author: Ck1

customer_reviews.title: An amazing mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say other than this is a high quality, well constructed, and amazing mouse pad. It looks and feels great with no tracking issues from my mouse. I do have to mention that there was an odd odor to it when I first opened it, but that quickly disappeared over the period of a few days. I was so satisfied with it that I ordered a second one for my wife's computer desk and she absolutely loves it. It easily accommodates a large keyboard, mouse, with room to spare. I purchased it while on sale for $15 but wouldn't hesitate to purchase it again at it's full price of $30. Great product and highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jose L. Machorro

customer_reviews.title: Boyfriend Approved
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my boyfriend for Christmas in 2017. Today, 12.11.2019, he is still using it and have no complains. The fact that it's plastic and it feels more slippery to use (at least in my opinion) he prefers it this way for accurate use when he plays video games. As long as he's happy with it, I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Rani Kartikasari

customer_reviews.title: CORSAIR MM300 is great!
customer_reviews.text: Great. Made by Corsair. Simple packaging - open the box, get it out, unroll, proceed to throw away what isn't a mouse pad. Large enough for my entire keyboard and mouse area; small enough to not fall off my table. The edges are stitched, not cut/melted off. My wrist doesn't have an stress marks after LONG uses without breaks. Surface is SMOOTH for my mouse to slide on. Check your desk dimensions before you buy. Check to see if you like the graphic on the mouse pad since it's not pure black and isn't one of those reverse-able. Regular quality o' mouse pad that only cover your mouse area might be $15 but this is an extended sized...its a steal.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Jay

customer_reviews.title: Major upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I've been using some trash Dota 2 mousepad from Lootcrate for years and that thing would slide all over my desk and my mouse would always fly off of it because I have the reach of an orangutan but this mousepad is pretty nice, its got some cool little lip thing that goes around it so you know when you have reached the limit of the mouse pad and need to readjust yourself. My new mouse glides pretty smoothly across it and even though its made of cloth it doesn't catch on it at all.
customer_reviews.author: David Sampson

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse pads, colors vary
customer_reviews.text: The most recent mouse pad I ordered is a true grey. I have two others from previous purchases which have a brown tone. If I could choose, I'd pick the one with the slight brown tone, since I've taken a liking to "warmer looking" stuff lately. The grey pad still looks good though. Regardless of the color, I really like this mouse pad for home and at work.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M. Clemente

customer_reviews.title: Overall a solid mouse pad.
customer_reviews.text: It's not perfect, but: - Great tracking (as expected, and the logo is completely non-intrusive) - Usable dimensions (for FPS gaming, or whatever else) - Clean stitched edges - Non-slip backing does a fair job of not slipping (though I do have to adjust it slightly from time to time) Sell me this tracking surface on a 5-6mm thick pad that is 36" wide, and we can talk about that fifth star.
customer_reviews.author: allkindsofbad

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: By far the best mousepad I ever bought, this thing is so nice and the mouse moves like butter on this thing compared to my previous mousepad. Its a mousepad and it does its job, nothing more to really say, Buy it! don't even hesitate, it doesn't have RGB but it will look hella sexy on anyone's desk.
customer_reviews.author: MastaX

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: The material is great. I build a lot of custom computers ranging from basic office to gaming or workstations and I've had a lot of experience with all kinds of different mouse pads. I prefer the extended for my own person system, having used a Razer Goliath for some time, but after recently switching to this Corsair I find I like the material far better and it isn't as thick as my Razer was. Goes great with my Corsair mouse and keyboard too.
customer_reviews.author: Chad L. Garber

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse Pad
customer_reviews.text: Great Mouse Pad, So far its very well made material that doesn't absorbs liquids or dirt and lint. Works really well for optical mouse, it seems that my mouse pretty much floats on this pad and has no problem moving easily on this material. feels like my fan in my room moves the mouse as well with ease specially when i put my computer to sleep it will turn it on if my fan is faced towards my desk due to its slick surface material for mosues.
customer_reviews.author: Vladimir Carranza

customer_reviews.title: good concept.. but..
customer_reviews.text: Mouse works great on it but the thing is huge and the charging is SLOW. If they could incorporate fast charging to the mousepad it would be worth it. The way it is, I would not recommend. Also it's nice that they include an adapter for phones without wireless charging. I was able to utilize the adapter since I have a pop socket on my phone, and like all wireless chargers, it will not work with the pop socket.
customer_reviews.author: Phil McCrotch

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Lie Flat
customer_reviews.text: As you can clearly see in the attached image this mouse pad does not lie flat. Note that I've had this for many many months now and have tried placing books and other heavy things on top of it. For what I got it's not worth it at any price. It still functions okay, but it looks awful and the edges catch on my wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Gray

customer_reviews.title: Very spacious and comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: There is plenty of room for all of your peripherals, and my wrist is much more comfortable during long gaming sessions/general computing than before with just my hard wood desk. There is a "new car" smell, but that will go away after a few days.
customer_reviews.author: KingTeranas

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice but...
customer_reviews.text: In general the quality of the mouse pad is outstanding, but, there is a little functional problem. The cable of the mouse gets interrupted with the bump in the upper side of the pad. This issue maes the use of a mouse bungee obligatory with this mouse pad. Other than that, the lights are awesome, and the integration with Icue sofware is pretty nice!
customer_reviews.author: Jhem Leonardo Modesto

customer_reviews.title: What a horrific mouse pad!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse pad to charge my phone while I play games. In the middle of one of my games the mouse stopped working that I had plugged into the mouse pad. It was the charging of the cellphone that would interrupt the actions of the mouse. I take off the phone and the mouse works again. Big fail on Corsair and I am not happy. Returning right away.
customer_reviews.author: Martino

customer_reviews.title: If you are looking for a pad with friction for control, this is not it, champ.
customer_reviews.text: Dislikes: -This pad smelled beyond awful. I don't know what the hell they coated this thing with during manufacturing, but it will literally give you migraines if you smell it long enough. Compounding this issue was the fact that both of my forearms would smell like this pad from just being in contact with it after a session on the computer. My forearms would literally itch from being in contact with this thing. It's that bad. Yikes. -The seeming lack of friction on this thing. The pad is way too fast. This makes tracking and more importantly control incredibly difficult. Likes: -It feels nice. -Yeah that's about it.
customer_reviews.author: Customer 2312

customer_reviews.title: Sucks when you lock your computer.
customer_reviews.text: There is a default profile that rapidly rainbows your mousepad when you lock your computer. If you use this in your bedroom, good luck falling asleep. Wish there was a way to change the built in profile to a customized setting.
customer_reviews.author: emike09

customer_reviews.title: Color is Off - I Expected Better From Corsair
customer_reviews.text: After reviewing other photos it’s clear the color varies between brown and gray. This throws off the look of my build **im editing my review to include more disappointment... I want to mention I’ve had this mat airing-out a month now and it still has the original terrible smell. I’m still bothered by the ugly brown color everyday. I hate this thing
customer_reviews.author: Ariel

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I've used a trackball since the dawn of time, but when I decided to play around with gaming, I knew I needed something a bit faster. And, if I was going to get a gaming mouse... I needed a mousepad. This pad has been very nice and comfortable to use. I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: D. C.

customer_reviews.title: Solid product at fair price point, get your nostrils ready upon opening
customer_reviews.text: Really comfortable and great size to cover a large area. Simple, sleek design goes great with a black desk and darker color accessories. The box absolutely smells awful for some reason, don't know what that's about but the mat smells fine'ish. I'm sure that'll fade quickly.
customer_reviews.author: D. Naylor

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty nice.
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice functional extended mousepad. My mouse works fine on it, I've used both a Steel Series Rival 600 and I use a Corsair Scimitar as my daily driver, my cursor moves nice and fluid and I don't have any complaints on the pad. I've spilled water a couple times on the pad since I've bought it on accident and there doesn't seem to be any noticable damage to it or quality degrading in it. As for cleaning it idk if it's machine washable I probably wouldn't do that but if you eat at your desk crumbs don't really stick to it or anything, it's really easy to keep clean.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy A Jendrzejewski

customer_reviews.title: Terrible customer service. Bad company, great product.
customer_reviews.text: Feels and looks great. Too bad they have terrible customer service. Bad company, good product. One of the few solid things that Corsair sells. Stay away from almost everything else but this. I give 4 stars because of customer service, otherwise a 5 star review overall. Product is not bad, just the company.
customer_reviews.author: MHaddad

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for over 2 years now. It's stained from who knows how many cups of coffee I've splashed on it, but my mouse still rolls smoothly so I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: chi657

customer_reviews.title: Review after over a year use
customer_reviews.text: So much had happened to this mouse pad and it is still holding just fine! Definitely worth paying for the quality, compared to cheaper brands of mouse pad that usually starts to fray or slide around after some time. Only thing I wish was getting it bigger, but this was what I was looking for at the time!
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Best mouse pad I've owned
customer_reviews.text: Was bit a skeptical about it's size, thinking I may not need something so large. But then said, what the heck lets get this. I am not disappointed. It's also so smooth that my mouse just glides over this and honestly my accuracy in FPS games has gotten MUCH better. I am 100% impressed and happy with this mouse pad.
customer_reviews.author: C Moon

customer_reviews.title: Full Coverage Pad
customer_reviews.text: Having a pad across the whole desk makes setting up the keyboard and mouse much easier. These mats are the next best thing to a whole desk pad which cost much more or need to be customized for the shape of the desk. No issues with the mouse, we use both Corsair products as well as some cheaper mice. I highly recommend these for your desk.
customer_reviews.author: D. Porrey

customer_reviews.title: Premium Quality, Bargain Price
customer_reviews.text: This product is made with high quality materials and lasts a long time. I've had one for two years and I just recently purchased another one for a second desktop setup. I still do not need to replace my original. I would advise anyone looking into buying a gaming mat to buy this one. Traditional mouse pads sometimes leave room to be desired but this mat is perfect if you have the room for it on your table or desk.
customer_reviews.author: Bee Ham

customer_reviews.title: If you don't have to, don't get this one.
customer_reviews.text: It is what it is. The irony of this product is that the non fray stitching is starting to fray. I've used my computer 10 times and 4 of those times for recording music. So, 6 gaming sessions before it started to fray at the ends. Only reason I got Corsair is because of the keyboard and mouse I have. where my fingers are the fray points. UPDATE 2020 : The bottom fray point has came out further. The rest of it has held up.
customer_reviews.author: Kara W.

customer_reviews.title: I want to like this mousepad but USB HUB IS BAD.
customer_reviews.text: Well the lighting is nice to go with my Corsair K95 RGB Platinum, but the massive downside that makes this not worth it is that annoying USB hub that can and will affect your ability to maneuver a wired mouse due to the corners. Which as you might expect becomes a bit annoying after a while. If it were more curve than corner that elevated area right in the center wouldn't be an issue, but no amount of tape for the wire to a tower, speaker, mousepad or USB hub itself can remedy this as those options also have their drawbacks.
customer_reviews.author: Donny Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Looked and Sounded Good But...
customer_reviews.text: I tried the small version. Nice classy design, but the neoprene/rubber is so thin and lightweight that it doesn't lay perfectly flat and is prone to moving slightly. This issue also gives the pad a cheap flimsy feeling which is disappointing given the brand and price. Serious gamers may want to avoid this pad. My last mouse pad was a nice heavy SteelSeries QcK mass Gaming Mouse Pad. I'm going back to that.
customer_reviews.author: dobetter
